newsitem.title: USA: American to hire 360 new flight attendants.
newsitem.headline: American to hire 360 new flight attendants.

text.p: American Airlines said Monday it will hire about 360 new flight attendants this year and expects to continue hiring more in 1998 and 1999.

"While we are still formulating our plans for the next two years, we expect a need for additional flight attendants to accommodate growth and normal attrition," said Mike Gunn, American's senior vice president of marketing.
American, a unit of AMR Corp. based in Fort Worth, Texas, did not return calls seeking comment on the current number of flight attendants.
AMR's stock fell 50 cents to $95.50 on the New York Stock Exchange in consolidated late trading.
